text: Are production networks and office networks separated with only the minimum connections needed between them?
hint: Segmentation reduces the chance that office issues affect production systems.

text: Is remote access to controllers or production systems protected with an extra sign-in step and allowed only when needed?
hint: Limiting and protecting remote access reduces common attack paths.

text: Are firmware and software updates for production devices planned with suppliers and applied on a set schedule?
hint: Planned updates reduce unpatched weaknesses in connected equipment.

text: Is the use of portable drives on production systems restricted and are they scanned before use?
hint: Portable drives can bypass network protections and introduce harmful software.

text: Is supplier remote access enabled only during maintenance windows and turned off when work is complete?
hint: Temporary access reduces ongoing exposure from unused connections.

text: Are configuration backups for controllers and key devices stored safely so the system can be restored after a fault or attack?
hint: Configuration backups reduce downtime and speed up recovery.
